result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Eugene Hebbe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence Eugene Hebbe in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ms McCormick on the phone.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. States motion  to amend Count 1 to straight Misd. battery, strike all domestic abuse references. Court grants motion. Dismiss count 2. DEF pled N/C to amended charge. Found guilty.   Victim had been notified, did not speak with DA. Is on the phone-gives statement.  Court tells Ms McCormick to speak only to how she has been affected. Atty McLaughlin: DEF is currently enrolled in anger management class with VA. Letter in file, mitigates claim of fear. Mr Hebbe is an appropriate candidate for probation. DEF: promises to never be in court again or to harm anyone, is only support in home. 
Count 1: amend to straight Battery   DEF pleads NC found guilty - Sentence withheld.  1 year probation. Successfully complete anger management course he his curently enrolled in with VA .Fine/forfeiture of $100 + costs, $ 579.00. Payment schedule to be worked out with agent.  No violent contact with Francesca McCormick.  Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
Count 2:   Dismiss and read-in and read-in 15cm109

Off the Record - Defendant Lawrence Eugene Hebbe in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

NO ABUSIVE CONTACT w/Francesca McCormick or L.H. d.o.b. 5-22-2008.
No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages.  
DE is only allowed contact with property of Francesca McCormick in order to do farm work necessary upon the property.

NO ABUSIVE CONTACT with Francesca McCormick or L.H. dob 5-22-2008
No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages.
DE is allowed contact with property of Francesca McCormick in order to do farm work necessary upon the property.

NO ABUSIVE CONTACT w/Francesca McCormick or L.H. d.o.b. 5-22-2008.
No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages.  
DE is only allowed contact with property of Francesca McCormick in order to do farm work necessary upon the property.

APPEARANCES:  John Yackel appeared for the State.  DE appeared in person. Franchesca McCormick appeared via telephone.

Franchesca wishes to get the bond modified to allow DE the ability to come in contact with her property in order to help out with chores and farm work.  Both parties agree.  Court modifies bond to NO ABUSIVE CONTACT w/Franchesca McCormick and to allow DE ability to do farm work necessary upon the property.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Lawrence Eugene Hebbe in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Franchesca McCormick appeared via telephone.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, and wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas to Counts 1 and 1 on behalf of DE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Mr. Hebbe called to say he was living at 16749 W. Boyland Road, Stone Lake, WI 54876.  Telephone number 715-865-2490

NO CONTACT with Francesca McCormick/L.H. 05-22-08.
No possession or consumption of alcohlic beverages.

Defendant Lawrence E. Hebbe in custody by video.  Bruce Poquette for the State.  DE satisfied with video.  Probable cause found.  SIBS $500.  NO contact with Francesca McCormick/L.H. 05-22-08.  No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages.   Defendant staying with Dwight Metcalf will call C of C with address and phone.
